items.title: Zydus’s MedTech plan underlines transformative changes in pharma sector
items.description: Pharma companies are trying to build revenue resilience by adding new business lines

items.title: Ixigo – Is this journey worth the price?
items.description: The anticipated consumption slowdown hasn’t impacted the travel and tourism sector so far

items.title: CLSA maintains 'overweight' on IndusInd Bank despite ongoing uncertainty, says shares can rally 31%
items.description: Over the next few quarters, CLSA said that there will be lingering uncertainty over more skeletons in the closet and management continuity.

items.title: Hindustan Aeronautics: Execution strength, order pipeline to ensure growth
items.description: Anticipated contracts for LCA Mark 1A, Light Combat Helicopters, Advanced Light Helicopters and the like, and improving visibility stand the company in good stead

items.title: Nifty IT enters bear market, sinks 21% from highs to erase Rs 8.4 lakh crore in value
items.description: Given the global uncertainties, investors are highly uncertain regarding the growth outlook of the Indian IT landscape, which depends on exports for revenues.

items.title: Momentum funds, once star performers, are now in a free fall
items.description: Momentum funds have suffered deep cuts in the past three months as the selloff has hurt the category, and experts are advicing investors to consider them only with a longer term investment horizon of more than a year.

items.title: Coromandel Intl shares in focus on plans to acquire 53% stake in NACL Industries
items.description: Coromandel International share price in focus on plans to acquire a 53% stake from NACL's current promoter, KLR Products, for a sum of Rs 820 crore.

items.title: Chart of the Day: IT stock valuations still out of sync with revenue growth rates
items.description: The current revenue estimates indicate notably slower growth in FY25 and FY26 compared to pre-COVID years

items.title: Bharat Electronics shares gain on orders win of Rs 2,463 crore
items.description: Bharat Electronics Share Price | On March 5, the board of directors of the company declared interim dividend of Rs 1.50 per equity share of Re 1 each (150 percent) for the financial year 2024-25.

items.title: Stock Market LIVE Updates: Nifty above 22,500, Sensex up 190 pts; MTNL gains 15%, autos slip
items.description: Sensex Today | Stock Market LIVE Updates: Buying is seen in the metal, bank, energy, pharma, while selling is seen in the auto, IT, realty. ONGC, Tata Steel, NTPC, HUL, Bajaj Finserv are among major gainers on the Nifty, while losers are Shriram Finance, Hindalco, Grasim, Hero MotoCorp, Apollo Hospitals. BSE Midcap and smallcap indices are trading in the red.

items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: Global stocks rose on Wednesday with U.S. Treasury yields as relief over cooler U.S. inflation in February was countered by uncertainty around U.S. President Donald Trump's tariff policies and their potential impact on inflation and global growth.

items.title: Stocks to Watch Today: Infosys, BEML, Jubilant Pharmova, Bharat Electronics, NACL Industries, Yatra Online, Swelect Energy Systems in focus on 13 March
items.description: Stocks to Watch, Mar 13: Stocks like Tata Steel, NHPC, NTPC Green Energy, Firstsource Solutions, Coromandel International, SP Apparels, Zydus Lifesciences, Jaiprakash Associates, Rollatainers, Satin Creditcare Network, and Ola Electric Mobility will be in focus on March 13.

items.title: Trade Spotlight: How should you trade Crompton Greaves Consumer, Tata Motors, Kotak Mahindra Bank, SRF, ITD Cementation, and others on March 13?
items.description: The benchmark indices are likely to be rangebound in the upcoming sessions. Below are some trading ideas for the near term.
